creator: hyoshiok@computer.org
text: the compilation was done on a limited environment. I will attach config.log.

creator: jwoolley@apache.org
text: Can you post a backtrace please?  See http://httpd.apache.org/dev/debugging.html

creator: hyoshiok@computer.org
text:
backtrace of compilation process? or line number where the compilation stopped?
anyway I retried, for finding that the make stopped in other place. 
--
scoreboard.c: In function `ap_get_scoreboard_process':
scoreboard.c:502: Internal error: Segmentation fault.
--
make clean, re./configure, remake and stops in yet another point.
--
make[4]: *** [apr_uri.lo] Error 1
make[4]: Leaving directory `/home/admin/httpd-2.0.36/srclib/apr-util/uri'
--I will make clearer what exactly is going on and repost/reopen.

creator: jwoolley@apache.org
text:
Ohhhhh, the actual *compilation* segfaulted?  Let me guess, you're using 
RedHat, probably 7.1, probably with gcc 2.96.  You have a broken compiler.  I 
believe an upgrade is available from ftp://updates.redhat.com.
